trans-unit.source: This topic describes rules for naming queues and queue metadata.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes rules for naming queues and queue metadata.

trans-unit.source: Every queue within an account must have a unique name.
trans-unit.target: Every queue within an account must have a unique name.

trans-unit.source: The queue name must be a valid DNS name, and cannot be changed once created.
trans-unit.target: The queue name must be a valid DNS name, and cannot be changed once created.

trans-unit.source: Queue names must confirm to the following rules:
trans-unit.target: Queue names must confirm to the following rules:

trans-unit.source: A queue name must start with a letter or number, and can only contain letters, numbers, and the dash (-) character.
trans-unit.target: A queue name must start with a letter or number, and can only contain letters, numbers, and the dash (-) character.

trans-unit.source: The first and last letters in the queue name must be alphanumeric.
trans-unit.target: The first and last letters in the queue name must be alphanumeric.

trans-unit.source: The dash (-) character cannot be the first or last character.
trans-unit.target: The dash (-) character cannot be the first or last character.

trans-unit.source: Consecutive dash characters are not permitted in the queue name.
trans-unit.target: Consecutive dash characters are not permitted in the queue name.

trans-unit.source: All letters in a queue name must be lowercase.
trans-unit.target: All letters in a queue name must be lowercase.

trans-unit.source: A queue name must be from 3 through 63 characters long.
trans-unit.target: A queue name must be from 3 through 63 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Metadata for a queue resource is stored as name-value pairs.
trans-unit.target: Metadata for a queue resource is stored as name-value pairs.

trans-unit.source: Beginning with REST API version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for <externalLink><linkText>C# identifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa664670%28VS.71%29.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Beginning with REST API version 2009-09-19, metadata names must adhere to the naming rules for <externalLink><linkText>C# identifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa664670%28VS.71%29.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Existing metadata names that do not adhere to these naming rules can be used with earlier versions of the Queue service, but not with REST API version 2009-09-19 or later.
trans-unit.target: Existing metadata names that do not adhere to these naming rules can be used with earlier versions of the Queue service, but not with REST API version 2009-09-19 or later.

trans-unit.source: Note that metadata names preserve the case with which they were created, but are case-insensitive when set or read.
trans-unit.target: Note that metadata names preserve the case with which they were created, but are case-insensitive when set or read.

trans-unit.source: If two or more metadata headers with the same name are submitted for a resource, the Queue service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: If two or more metadata headers with the same name are submitted for a resource, the Queue service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).
